intro: Phelipanche ducellieri, commonly known as the common yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb that is parasitic, relying on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are typically tubular in shape. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its growth habit and parasitic nature make it an important species in ecological studies of plant interactions.
